attributes.action: Allow Council meetings to be held as a hybrid of virtual and in person.
attributes.additional_details: The Covid pandemic has forced the use of technology,  but has shown that technology is safe to use to hold meetings.  I would like to propose that Parliament brings forward a bill to allow hybrid meetings,  those where you have the choice of how to attend,  as soon as possible. This would also cut down journeys.
attributes.background: Bring in emergency legislation to change the rule that local councils have to meet in person.

rejection.details: The Government has created new powers for local authorities in England to hold public meetings virtually by using video or telephone conferencing technology from 4 April 2020: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/councils-given-new-powers-to-hold-public-meetings-remotely
